column7: >It is a special time of the year, remembering one man's death, and with it, His gift of eternal renewal to many. I wish all of you a joyfully reflective Easter and Passover season.

column16: href=""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyeonggi-do"" target=""_blank"">Gyeonggi-do Province of Korea. During the biennale I have also been invited to participate in an onsite

I am very much looking forward to it. Details are below.

column7: >In August I participated in an anagama workshop at <a style=""color:#4F569F
column10: href=""http://pvcrafts.org"" target=""_blank"">Peters Valley Craft Center.
column13: href=""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anagama_kiln"" target=""_blank"">Anagama is a traditional Japanese hillside ceramic kiln and firing process in which ash and flame from wood used to fuel the kiln over several (4-8) days forms the glaze and surface treatment of the works inside. I&rsquo
column14: m particularly drawn to the sweeping variation of earthtones and textures that come about fortuitously in response to the form of a piece, it&rsquo
column15: s kiln position and the firing style, a symbiotic interplay that yields beautifully dynamic results. From this workshop I&rsquo

column8: m sad to see the summer ending but I am grateful for the positive developments and challenges that have come through it. I wish you all well as we head into the fall.

column1: Labor Day Fair,02-Sep-2010 09:30 PM GMT-05:00,211,123,"<table width=""100%"" border=""0"" cellpadding=""0"" cellspacing=""20"">

column3: >

column1: Exhibit Hours: Noon - 6 p.m. every show day
Location: Washington Square Park @ Washington Square East NY NY 10003. Near the West 4th, Astor Place and 8th st subway stops - see map. My booth will probably be on University Place near 8th street.

column2: Acrylic, Watercolor Photography, Sculpture, Crafts, Jewelry, Metal Work, Ceramics, Glass Mixed Media, Fiber, Wood

column1: It's a twice-a-year happening every Memorial Day Weekend and the weekend that follows and every Labor Day Weekend and the weekend that follows that. The event showcases fine artists and craft artisans from around the New York metropolitan area, the nation and the world. Attendees come from all over and are a cosmopolitan mix, including art lovers, tourists, faculty and students from the area's many schools and professionals such as interior designers. I'll be selling!

The show has its venue on University Place, starting at East 10th Street and extending south along the east side of Washington Square Park to West 3rd Street. The southern end of the show encompasses Schwartz Plaza, also known as Bobkin Lane, between NYU's Shimkin Hall and Bobst Library.

column1: Moscow Clayworks Show,11-Jul-2011 09:00 PM GMT-05:00,219,115,"<table border=""0"" cellspacing=""0"" cellpadding=""0"" class=""page-body"">

column7: >In 2006 I did a summer assistantship at <a href=""http://www.pvcrafts.org"" style=""color:#4F569F
column10: >Peters Valley Craft Center's ceramics department that significantly pushed my sense of creative freedom as an artist. In the woods of the valley, surrounded by the dust of clay and the smoke of fiery kilns, I produced what ultimately became the first models of my recently completed bronze series. I also had the pleasure of meeting and being inspired by many artists, namely the head of Peters Valley's ceramics department,
column16: >Moscow Clayworks Bruce has organized a show of works from assistants he has overseen through his tenure. I will be exhibiting my piece,
column19: >Jonah. For those of you who can make it out to Moscow PA or live nearby, you are welcome to attend the opening this coming Sunday. It will be a delightful gathering of artists and a beautiful display of artwork for all. Details are below:

column1: New Pieces,05-Nov-2010 09:45 PM GMT-05:00,211,146,"<table border=""0"" cellspacing=""0"" cellpadding=""0"" class=""page-body"">

column7: >After a while of committed development I have recently completed <a href=""http://www.baralaye.com/sculpture"" style=""color:#4F569F
column10: >four sculpture pieces. They represent my first considerable body of work produced in the past few years and a substantial journey for me in becoming familiar and practiced with the lost-wax metal casting process. All four of the pieces are a part of what I've recognized to be a ""Testament"" series dedicated to individuals from the Old and New Testament of the bible.

column7: >I'm pleased with the way the works have turned out and look forward to the more to come. I thank you all for your support and encouragement.

column7: >Participating in the Gyeonggi International Ceramix Biennale was a delight from the moment I stepped onto Korea. For 10 days I and thirty-nine other artists from around the globe had the pleasure of working in clay alongside each other at the Biennale&rsquo
column8: s Icheon site. I made some new friends and networking connections, gained professional insights and widened artistic awareness. I was overall inspired by the passion and diversity of the arts being expressed around me and Korea&rsquo
column9: s invested support in cultivating creativity.  Along with exploring <a style=""color:#4F569F
column12: href=""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Icheon"">Icheon I got to spend some time gallery hopping in the art district area of
column18: href=""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seoul"">Seoul. I even learned a bit more of the language though I relied heavily on the generous help of bilingual speakers and kind strangers. I am looking forward to visiting again. Here are
